content: uplifter crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials size 12 by 66 inches 30 5 by 168 cm the pattern repeat is 4 stitches to make a longer scarf add stitches to your starting chain in multiples of 4 to make a shorter scarf subtract stitches from your starting chain in multiples of 4 yarn dk weight you will need about 590 yards 540 meters of yarn the sample scarf used 1 cake of lion brand mandala yarn 100% acrylic 590 yards 450 m per 150-gram cake in the colorway mothra you can use any yarn you like use the hook size recommended on the label you can use scraps if you prefer go with the flow of color changes- no cutting or controlling of colors needed yarn dk weight hook 5 mm us h gauge 11 double_crochet stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 8 25 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us chain chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook sts stitches double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through both loops on hook foundation double_crochet a method for beginning a row without having to make a separate row of chains first see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation- double-crochet-fdc/ for a video tutorial uplifter crochet pattern © 2021 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful uplifter row 1 chain 236 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and all chain across 234 double_crochet sts or foundation double_crochet 234 sts see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 234 double_crochet sts row 2 chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet in next st chain 2 skip 2 sts double_crochet in each of the next 2 double_crochet 58 times 234 sts 58 spaces made row 3 chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet in next st 2 double_crochet in next space double_crochet in each of the next 2 double_crochet across 234 double_crochet row 4-25 repeat row 2 and 3 fasten_off and weave in ends block if desired share your scarf with #uplifterscarf on instagram please feel free to sell finished items made from this pattern as long as you give design credit as uplifter crochet pattern by pretty peaceful not for commercial use please do not share photos of this pattern only share the link to the pattern pdf on ravelry or etsy thank you for your support uplifter crochet pattern © 2021 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful
